snippet: Mary T. Barra, before a House panel for a second time, faced sharp questioning from members skeptical of the carmaker’s internal investigation into recall delays.
abstract: Testimony of Mary T Barra, chief executive of General Motors, and company's outside lawyer Anton Valukas leaves lawmakers at House hearing more frustrated and skeptical about carmaker's commitment to safety; hearing was meant to be opportunity for company to rebuild credibility with lawmakers, as well as family members of car crash victims, in wake of its longtime failure to recall defective small cars.

byline.original: By BILL VLASIC and DANIELLE IVORY

lead_paragraph: Mary T. Barra, before a House panel for a second time, faced sharp questioning from members skeptical of the carmaker’s internal investigation into recall delays.

headline.main: Barra Faces Scrutiny in House Over G.M. Recalls
headline.print_headline: G.M.’s Chief Fails to Appease Panel About Safety
